title: Big thanks to CertainlyT.
body:
I used to be be trash, but not anymore :D.

All thanks to his amazing buffs!

Put CertainlyT on max wage rito!

http://i.imgur.com/CUEJq9W.png

replies.body: Please no, this is the guy that designed Zed, Kalista, Darius, Zyra, Yasuo and Thresh, do you want more broken champions?

> [{quoted}](name=MasterCorgi,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=O6EFEpW6,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-04-03T19:04:53.293+0000)
>
> Please no, this is the guy that designed Zed, Kalista, Darius, Zyra, Yasuo and Thresh, do you want more broken champions?

Broken? they are the most fun champions in the game.
Yup, although Zyra and Darius are fine... Now...
CertainlyT did something nice? Fk him anyway. -Community
How hard can it be to come up with the idea of lowering cooldowns and a mana shield, hell it was the community that came up with that, CertainlyT is honestly just a terrible designer :/

Shouldn't we be encouraging good behavior?

_Especially_ good behavior that the community actually asked for?

From CertainlyT?
There's no reason to thank certainlyT, he barely played any part in this and it still doesn't excuse how terrible a designer he is, it's a sad truth, every champ he's made is, or was insanely broken.

I don't think he's a bad designer.
He's a bad balancer.

Unfortunately, they're almost completely different departments.
He needs to moonlight on the balance team for a while. Or have a balance team intern assigned to him with a rolled-up newspaper.

Kinda not related to the topic, but why exactly was CertainlyT associated with these changes so strongly? I mean at the end of the day all he got was a reduced ult coolown and a mana ratio on his shield (which was popularly requested by the community). Surely anyone could have made those changes for him, and getting a specific designer was unnecessary.

The balance team confuses me.
Yeah, now he's pick/ban in Korea. Yup, great job.
